item.title: Remote
item.description: Back in 80s and 90s, which, arguably, was the golden age of programming if we look at evolution of the Classic languages (Lisp and ML family), we did not have any “online” real-time constant-presence crap (except IRC, which was fun). All the means of communication we had back then were , in principle, text-based, off-line, /asynchronous. In short, we used the ancient “paradigm”, which goes back to the ancient “spiritual practices”, based on solitude, withdrawal from society, observation after taking a step back, and focused introspection.
